document.masterDocTitle: A new species of the rare Neotropical genus Auloceromyia Lindner, 1969 (Diptera: Stratiomyidae) and the first record of the male of A. pedunculata Pimentel & Pujol-Luz, 2000

tr.th:
FIGURES 25–27.
Auloceromyia pachypoda
nov. sp. , male
Genital capsule, dorsal view. 27. Genital capsule, ventral
gonocoxite; goncx apod, gonocoxal apodeme; prct, proctiger.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 28–29.
Auloceromyia pachypoda
nov. sp. , phallic complex (aedeagus + parameral sheath), holotype. 28. Dorsal view. 29. Ventral view. Abbreviations: lt lb, lateral lobe; md lb, medial lobe.

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology. The species name is feminine, and the specific epithet comes from the Greek roots pachys , meaning thick, and podos , foot, as a reference to the female’s enlarged and expanded hind femur and basitarsus of the species.
Geographic distribution. Brazil (State of Mato Grosso do Sul) and Argentina (Provincie of Entre Ríos).
The holotype antennae are missing and the abdomen (segments 1–5 ) is glued on the locality label.
